original: “Settlement Date ” has the meaning defined in  Section 3  hereof.
ollama_generated:
"For purposes of this Agreement, the term 'Settlement Date' shall be construed in accordance with the definition provided in Section 3 hereto."

This version maintains the professional tone while shifting the responsibility slightly from defining the term externally to acknowledging its definition has been provided within the agreement itself.

original: “Effective Time ” with respect to the Registration Statement, means the date and time as of which such Registration Statement was declared effective by the Commission.
ollama_generated: "Efficient Timing," in reference to the Registration Statement, denotes the point in time when the Commission officially approves and declares it effective, noting both the date and the hour at which such approval occurs. This term implies that subsequent events or actions, related to the Registration Statement, should be referenced from this decisive moment onwards.

original: Unless otherwise specified, a reference to a “ rule” or “Rule” is to the indicated rule under the Act.
modified: save for instances where expressly stated otherwise, a mention of "rule" or "Rule" shall be construed as referring to any applicable regulation or provision within the given Act, at the discretion of the relevant authority.

original: federal and state securities laws and the limited liability company agreement, limited partnership agreement or other organizational document of each Subsidiary; and have not conveyed, transferred, assigned, pledged or hypothecated any of their respective equity interests in their Subsidiaries, in whole or in part, or granted any rights, options or rights of first refusal or first offer to purchase any of such interests or any portion thereof.
modified: Each Subsidiary shall comply with federal and state securities laws, as well as the governing documents, i.e., the limited liability company agreement, limited partnership agreement, or other organizational document applicable to it. Additionally, each Subsidiary retains the right to freely convey, transfer, assign, pledge, or hypothecate any of their respective equity interests in their Subsidiaries, in whole or in part, subject only to any contractual restrictions or obligations that may be imposed by third parties, if any. No rights, options, or rights of first refusal or first offer to purchase any of such interests or any portion thereof have been granted to any party, unless explicitly stated and documented in writing.

original: (xii)OP Units and Preferred OP Units .
ollama_generated:
(xii) The Holder's Right to Redeem and Transfer OP Units and Preferred OP Units shall be subject to the Company's right of first refusal, with the understanding that the Holder may exercise such rights only if the Company elects not to exercise its own.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for initiating the redemption or transfer of OP Units and Preferred OP Units has been shifted from the Holder (who originally had the right to do so) to the Company, which now has the power to either perform the action itself or allow the Holder to do so. This changes the original clause by making it more likely that the Company will retain control over these transactions.

original: (xx)Utilities. To the knowledge of the Transaction Entities and their respective Subsidiaries, water, stormwater, sanitary sewer, electricity and telephone service are all available at the property lines of each Property over duly dedicated streets or perpetual easements of record benefiting the applicable Property.
modified:
(yy) Utilities: It is not warranted by the Transaction Entities or their respective Subsidiaries that water, stormwater, sanitary sewer, electricity, and telephone service are consistently available at the property lines of each Property over duly dedicated streets or perpetual easements of record benefiting the applicable Property. The Utilities may occasionally be disrupted due to maintenance, repairs, or other unforeseen circumstances beyond the control of the Transaction Entities or their respective Subsidiaries.

The implication here is that the availability and consistency of utilities are not guaranteed by the parties involved, and any disruptions could occur despite their best efforts.

original: (xxii)Absence of Existing Defaults and Conflicts . Neither of the Transaction Entities nor any of their respective Subsidiaries is (A) in violation of its respective Organizational Documents; (B) in default (or with the giving of notice or lapse of time would be in default) under any existing obligation, agreement, covenant or condition contained in any indenture, loan, contract, note, agreement, mortgage, lease or other agreement or instrument to which any of them is a party or by which any of them is bound or to which any of the properties of any of them is subject; or (C) in violation of any law or statute or any judgment, order, rule or regulation of any court or arbitrator or governmental or regulatory authority, except in the case of clauses (B) and (C) above, for any such default or violation that would not, individually or in the aggregate, have a Material Adverse Effect.
modified: (xxii) Presence of Compliance and Absence of Imminent Conflicts . No Transaction Entity nor any of their respective Subsidiaries is (A) currently in compliance with its respective Organizational Documents; (B) not currently in compliance (but is not expected to be, upon receipt of notice or passage of time, in non-compliance) under any existing obligation, agreement, covenant or condition contained in any indenture, loan, contract, note, agreement, mortgage, lease or other agreement or instrument to which any of them is a party or by which any of their properties is subject; or (C) in compliance with any law or statute or any judgment, order, rule or regulation of any court or arbitrator or governmental or regulatory authority. However, for the exceptions under clauses (B) and (C), the absence of compliance or violation should not, individually or in the aggregate, have a Material Adverse Effect in the near future. This clause does not preclude the occurrence of minor breaches that do not materially and adversely affect the overall performance of the transaction entities.

original: (xxiii)Absence of Dividend Restriction . Except as set forth in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, (i) neither of the Transaction Entities nor any of their respective Subsidiaries is currently prohibited, restricted or limited in its respective ability to pay, directly or indirectly, distributions or dividends to its equity holders, limited partners, general partners or members, as applicable, (ii) no Subsidiary is prohibited, directly or indirectly, from repaying to the Transaction Entities any loans or advances to such Subsidiary from the Transaction Entities or from transferring any of such Subsidiary’s property or assets to the Transaction Entities or any other Subsidiary and (iii) the Operating Partnership is not prohibited, directly or indirectly, from repaying to the Company any loans or advances to the Operating Partnership from the Company or from transferring any of the Operating Partnership’s property or assets to the Company.
ollama_generated: (xxiii) Presence of Potential Dividend Freedom: Except as specified in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, neither of the Transaction Entities nor any of their respective Subsidiaries currently possesses restrictions, limitations, or obligations that would impede them from voluntarily choosing to pay, directly or indirectly, distributions or dividends to their equity holders, limited partners, general partners, or members, as applicable. Furthermore, no Subsidiary is currently prevented, either directly or indirectly, from electing to repay loans or advances made to such Subsidiary by the Transaction Entities, nor from deciding to transfer any of its property or assets to the Transaction Entities or any other Subsidiary. Similarly, the Operating Partnership is not under any obligation, either directly or indirectly, to withhold repaying loans or advances made to it by the Company, nor to refrain from choosing to transfer any of its property or assets to the Company.

original: (xxix)Absence of Manipulation . None of the Transaction Entities, any of their respective Subsidiaries or any affiliates of the Transaction Entities, has taken, directly or indirectly, any action that is designed to or that has constituted or that would cause or result in the stabilization or manipulation of the price of any security of the Company to facilitate the sale or resale of the Offered Shares.
ollama_generated: (xxix) Absence of Price Interference: The Transaction Entities, their respective Subsidiaries, and any affiliates associated with the Transaction Entities, affirm that no action has been taken, either directly or indirectly, with the intention to, or resulting in, the artificial maintenance or manipulation of the price of any Company security. This is intended not to hinder subsequent resales of the Offered Shares, but to ensure fair and transparent market conditions.

original: (xxxiii)Disclosure Controls . The Company and its subsidiaries maintain an effective system of “disclosure controls and procedures” (as defined in Rule 13a-15(e) and Rule 15d-15 under the Exchange Act) that complies with the requirements of the Exchange Act and that has been designed to provide reasonable assurances that information required to be disclosed by the Company in reports that it files or submits under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the Commission’s rules and forms, including controls and procedures designed to ensure that such information is accumulated and communicated to the Company’s management as appropriate to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure, and such disclosure controls and procedures are effective in all material respects to perform the functions for which they were established.
ollama_generated: (xxxiii) Disclosure Controls and Procedures - The Company and its subsidiaries shall have in place a system of "disclosure controls and procedures," as defined under Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15 of the Exchange Act, that is intended to provide reasonable assurances. This system should aim to ensure that information needed for disclosures required by the Company in reports filed or submitted under the Exchange Act is accurately recorded, processed, summarized, and reported within the timeframes specified by the Commission's rules and forms. Additionally, these controls and procedures should be designed to enable management to make timely decisions regarding necessary disclosure and communicate this information appropriately. However, it is recognized that while efforts will be made to ensure the effectiveness of these disclosure controls and procedures in all material respects, they may not always perform perfectly and there may be instances where they do not function as intended.

original: (xxxvi)Financial Statements; Non-GAAP Financial Measures . The financial statements of the Company and its consolidated subsidiaries included in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, together with the related schedules and notes, present fairly in all material respects the financial position of the Company and its consolidated subsidiaries as of the dates indicated, and the balance sheet, statements of operations, changes in members’ equity and cash flows of the Company and its consolidated subsidiaries for the periods specified; said financial statements have been prepared in conformity with GAAP applied on a consistent basis throughout the periods involved and comply with the Commission’s rules and guidelines with respect thereto. The supporting schedules included in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus relating to the Company and its consolidated subsidiaries present fairly in accordance with GAAP the information required to be stated therein. The combined statements of revenue and certain expenses included in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, together with the related notes, comply with Rule 8-06 of Regulation S-X and present fairly in all material respects the revenue and certain expenses of the applicable Property for the periods specified; said financial statements have been prepared in conformity with GAAP applied on a consistent basis throughout the periods involved and comply with the Commission’s rules and guidelines with respect thereto. The selected financial data and the summary financial information included in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus present fairly the information shown therein and have been compiled on a basis consistent with that of the audited, or unaudited as applicable, financial statements of the Company and its consolidated Subsidiaries included therein and comply with the Commission’s rules and guidelines with respect thereto. The pro forma financial statements, if any, and the related notes thereto included in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus present fairly in all material respects the information shown therein, comply with the Commission’s rules and guidelines with respect to pro forma financial statements and have been properly compiled on the bases described therein, and the assumptions used in the preparation thereof are reasonable and the adjustments used therein are appropriate to give effect to the transactions and circumstances referred to therein. Except as included therein, no historical or pro forma financial statements or supporting schedules are required to be included in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package or the Prospectus under the Act or Rules and Regulations thereunder. All disclosures contained in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package or the Prospectus regarding “non- GAAP financial measures” (as such term is defined by the Rules and Regulations ) comply with Regulation G of the Exchange Act and Item 10 of Regulation S-K of the Act to the extent applicable.
ollama_generated:
(xxxvi) Financial Statements and Non-GAAP Financial Measures: The financial statements presented in this Registration Statement, General Disclosure Package, and Prospectus, along with the accompanying schedules and notes, are presented fairly, in all material aspects, for the periods specified and represent the financial position of the Company and its consolidated subsidiaries as of the indicated dates. These financial statements have been prepared in accordance with GAAP, consistently applied throughout the relevant periods, and conform to the Commission's rules and guidelines regarding such presentations.

The supporting schedules included herein provide information in accordance with GAAP for the Company and its consolidated subsidiaries as required. The combined statements of revenue and certain expenses presented in this Registration Statement, General Disclosure Package, and Prospectus, together with their related notes, comply with Rule 8-06 of Regulation S-X and accurately reflect the applicable Property's revenue and expenses for the specified periods.

The selected financial data and summary financial information included herein present the information shown in a manner consistent with that of the audited or unaudited financial statements of the Company and its consolidated subsidiaries, as applicable, and comply with the Commission's rules and guidelines regarding such presentations.

If provided, the pro forma financial statements and related notes included herein accurately reflect the information shown therein and adhere to the Commission's rules and guidelines for pro forma financial statements, are properly compiled on the bases described therein, and use reasonable assumptions and appropriate adjustments to account for the transactions and circumstances referenced.

Except as required by law or regulations, no historical or pro forma financial statements or supporting schedules are necessary for inclusion in this Registration Statement, General Disclosure Package, or Prospectus under the Act or its related rules and regulations. All disclosures regarding "non-GAAP financial measures" (as defined by the Rules and Regulations) included herein comply with Regulation G of the Exchange Act and Item 10 of Regulation S-K of the Act to the extent applicable.

original: (xlviii)Prior Sales of  Series A Preferred Stock, Series B Preferred Stock,  Series A Preferred OP Units, Series B Preferred OP Units, Series A OP Units or LTIP Units . Except as disclosed in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, the Company has not sold, issued or distributed any  Series A Preferred Stock and Series B Preferred Stock, and the Operating Partnership has not issued, sold or distributed any  Series A Preferred OP Units, Series B Preferred OP Units,  Series A OP Units or LTIP Units during the six-month period preceding the date hereof.
ollama_generated: (xlix) Prior Sales of Series A Preferred Stock, Series B Preferred Stock, Series A Preferred OP Units, Series B Preferred OP Units, Series A OP Units, or LTIP Units, other than as disclosed in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package, and the Prospectus, the Company may have engaged in sales, issuance, or distribution of Series A Preferred Stock and Series B Preferred Stock, and the Operating Partnership might have issued, sold, or distributed Series A Preferred OP Units, Series B Preferred OP Units, Series A OP Units, or LTIP Units during the six-month period preceding the date hereof. However, any such sales, issuance, or distribution will be subject to the terms and conditions outlined in the relevant offering documents, and the Company or Operating Partnership shall not be liable for any claims arising from such activities unless they constitute a breach of those terms.

original: (b)Certificates of Officers . Any certificate signed by any officer of either Transaction Entity, as applicable, and delivered to the Agent or its counsel in connection with the offering of the Offered Shares shall be deemed a representation and warranty by each Transaction Entity, as applicable, as to matters covered thereby, to the Agent.
modified: (b) Certificates of Officers: Any certificate signed by an officer of either Transaction Entity, as applicable, and delivered to the Agent or its counsel in relation to the issuance of the Offered Shares shall not serve as a representation or warranty to the Agent, but rather constitutes a statement that each Transaction Entity, as applicable, has reasonable grounds for believing the truth of the matters stated therein. This does not, however, impose on the Transaction Entities any obligation to verify the accuracy of such statements, nor shall it be considered a guarantee by the Transaction Entities of the accuracy or completeness of the information provided in the certificate.

original: (i)Good Standing of the Manager . The Manager has been duly organized and is validly existing as a limited liability company in good standing under the laws of the State of Delaware and has full power and authority to own, lease and operate its properties and to conduct its business as described in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus and to enter into and perform its obligations under this Agreement; and the Manager and each of its subsidiaries is duly qualified as a foreign entity to transact business and is in good standing in each other jurisdiction in which such qualification is required, whether by reason of the ownership or leasing of property or the conduct of business, except where the failure so to qualify or to be in good standing would not result in a Material Adverse Effect.
ollama_generated: (i) Good Standing of the Manager - The Manager, duly organized and currently existing as a limited liability company under the laws of the State of Delaware, maintains its status in good standing, possesses the requisite power and authority to own, lease, and operate its properties, engage in its stated business activities as detailed in the Registration Statement, General Disclosure Package, and Prospectus, and fulfill its obligations under this Agreement. It is also understood that the Manager and each of its subsidiaries, when necessary, are duly qualified as a foreign entity to transact business, but only if such qualification is not required or is obtained without causing a Material Adverse Effect in any jurisdiction where it conducts business or owns property.

original: (v)Possession of Licenses and Permits . The Manager possesses, and is in compliance with the terms of, all Licenses necessary or material to the conduct of the business of the Manager now conducted or proposed in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus to be conducted by the Manager, except where the failure to possess such Licenses would not, singly or in the aggregate, result in a Material Adverse Effect, and has not received any notice of proceedings relating to the revocation or modification of any Licenses that, if determined adversely to the Manager would, individually or in the aggregate, have a Material Adverse Effect.
ollama_generated: (v) License Compliance Obligations . The Manager shall not be held responsible for any lack of possession of Licenses required for the conduct of its business, as set forth in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, provided that this omission does not collectively or individually cause a Material Adverse Effect. However, the Manager is obligated to promptly disclose any knowledge it may have regarding ongoing proceedings relating to the revocation or modification of any Licenses, the determination of which against the Manager could potentially result in a Material Adverse Effect.

original: (ix)Absence of Proceedings . There are no actions, suits or proceedings (including any inquiries or investigations by any court or governmental agency or body, domestic or foreign) now pending, or, to the knowledge of the Manager, threatened against or affecting the Manager that, if determined adversely to the Manager, would, individually or in the aggregate, have a Material Adverse Effect.
modified: (ix) Existence of Proceedings . To the best of the Managed Party's knowledge, there are no actions, suits, proceedings (including any inquiries or investigations by any court or governmental agency or body, domestic or foreign), now pending or threatened, that if determined adversely to the Managed Party, could collectively constitute a Material Adverse Effect on its operations, assets, or liabilities. Any such action, suit, proceeding, inquiry, or investigation, either currently ongoing or threatened, shall be deemed a breach of this agreement by the Managed Party.

original: (xiii)Resources . The Manager has the financial and other resources available to it necessary for the performance of its services and obligations as contemplated hereby and in the Management Agreement, the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus.
ollama_generated: (xiii) Resource Allocation: The Manager acknowledges and assumes responsibility for ensuring that it possesses, at all times, the financial and other resources deemed necessary for the satisfactory fulfillment of its services and obligations as described herein, in the Management Agreement, the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package, and the Prospectus. In case of resource shortfall, the Manager shall promptly notify the relevant parties and devise a suitable contingency plan to maintain compliance with these documents.

original: (viii)Reporting Requirements . The Company, during the period when a prospectus relating to the Offered Shares is (or, but for the exception afforded by Rule 172, would be) required to be delivered under the Act, will file all documents required to be filed with the Commission pursuant to the Exchange Act within the time periods required by the Exchange Act and Rules and Regulations related thereto.
ollama_generated: (viii) Reporting Obligations . The Company shall endeavor to fulfill its reporting obligations, even in instances where a prospectus relating to the Offered Shares is not necessary under Rule 172, or if it would otherwise be required under the Act. However, any filings with the Commission pursuant to the Exchange Act will only be made when there is sufficient time to ensure compliance with the deadlines specified by the Exchange Act and Rules and Regulations associated therewith, taking into account the complexities of the reporting process.

original: (xii)Listing. The Company will maintain the registration of the Offered Shares pursuant to Section 12(b) of the Exchange Act as of the Settlement Date; and the Company will cause the Offered Shares to be listed on the NYSE MKT on or prior to the Settlement Date.
ollama_generated: (xii)Listing. The Investee shall endeavor to maintain the registration of the Offered Shares under Section 12(b) of the Exchange Act as of the Settlement Date, but any failure to do so shall not be deemed a breach of this Agreement unless such failure continues for more than thirty (30) days following notice. Additionally, while the Investee will strive to cause the Offered Shares to be listed on the NYSE MKT on or prior to the Settlement Date, any delay in listing shall not be considered a breach of this Agreement unless such delay exceeds one hundred and eighty (180) days. In either case, the Investor shall have the right to take reasonable steps to ensure compliance with this clause.

original: (b)The Manager agrees with the Agent that:
ollama_generated:
(b) The Manager acknowledges to the Agent that:

In the event of any dispute arising out of this agreement, the Manager shall have the sole discretion to initiate legal action. However, if the Manager chooses not to pursue such action, the Agent shall be released from any obligation to do so and shall bear no liability for failure to act. The Manager hereby indemnifies and holds harmless the Agent from any claims or damages arising out of such decision.

original: (c)No Material Adverse Change . Subsequent to the execution and delivery of this Agreement, there shall not have occurred (i) any change, or any development or event involving a prospective change, in the condition (financial or otherwise), results of operations, business, earnings, properties or prospects of the Transaction Entities and their respective Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, that, in the sole judgment of the Agent, is material and adverse and makes it impractical or inadvisable to market the Offered Shares; (ii) any change in either U.S. or international financial, political or economic conditions or currency exchange rates or exchange controls the effect of which is such as to make it, in the judgment of the Agent, impractical to market or to enforce contracts for the sale of the Offered Shares, whether in the primary market or in respect of dealings in the secondary market; (iii) any suspension or material limitation of trading in securities generally on the NYSE MKT, or any setting of minimum or maximum prices for trading on such exchange; (iv) or any suspension of trading of any securities of the Company on any national securities exchange or in the over-the-counter market; (v) any banking moratorium declared by any U.S. federal or New York authorities; (vi) any major disruption of settlements of securities, payment, or clearance services in the United States or any other country where such securities are listed; or (vii) any attack on, outbreak or escalation of hostilities or act of terrorism involving the United States, any declaration of war by Congress or any other national or international calamity or emergency if, in the judgment of the Agent, the effect of any such attack, outbreak, escalation, act, declaration, calamity or emergency is such as to make it impractical or inadvisable to market the Offered Shares or to enforce contracts for the sale of the Offered Shares.

(h)Company Officers’ Certificate . The Agent shall have received a certificate, dated the Settlement Date, of the Chief Executive Officer of the Company and the Chief Accounting Officer of the Company, in his capacity as the Principal Financial Officer of the Company, in which such officers shall state that: the representations and warranties of the Transaction Entities in this Agreement are true and correct as of such date; each of the Transaction Entities has complied with all agreements and satisfied all conditions on its part to be performed or satisfied hereunder at or prior to the Settlement Date; no stop order suspending the effectiveness of any Registration Statement has been issued and no proceedings for that purpose have been instituted or, to the best of their knowledge and after reasonable investigation, are contemplated by the Commission; the 462(b) Registration Statement (if any) satisfying the requirements of subparagraphs (1) and (3) of Rule 462(b) was timely filed pursuant to Rule 462(b), including payment of the applicable filing fee in accordance with the applicable Rules and Regulations; and, subsequent to the date of the most recent financial statements in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, there has been no change, nor any development or event involving a prospective change, in the condition (financial or otherwise), results of operations, earnings, business, properties or prospects of the Transaction Entities and their respective Subsidiaries, taken as a whole, that is material and adverse, except as set forth in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus or as described in such certificate.

(o)Subsidiary Good Standings . The Agent shall have received a certificate of good standing certified by the Secretary of State (or equivalent governmental authority) of the state of incorporation or formation as of a date no earlier than April 15, 2016, for each entity listed on  Schedule B  hereto.
modified: (p) Subsidiary Good Standings . The Agent shall not be responsible for verifying the good standing of each entity listed on Schedule B hereto before April 15, 2016. However, from April 15, 2016, onwards, the Agent will have received a certificate of good standing certified by the Secretary of State (or equivalent governmental authority) of the state of incorporation or formation as of a date no later than the date of this Agreement, for each entity listed on Schedule B hereto.

original: (t)Listing. An application for the listing of the Offered Shares shall have been approved for listing to the NYSE MKT prior to the Settlement Date.
ollama_generated:
(t)Listing. The Settlement Date will not occur unless the application for the listing of the Offered Shares has been conditionally approved for listing on the NYSE MKT, with final approval to be obtained no later than the Settlement Date.

The changes made in this clause shift the responsibility from the applicant (who previously had to ensure listing before the settlement date) to the exchange (now responsible for providing final approval by the settlement date). Additionally, the condition has been inverted so that the settlement will only occur if certain conditions are met.

original: 19.Jurisdiction . Each of the Transaction Entities and the Manager hereby submits to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the Federal and state courts in the Borough of Manhattan in The City of New York in any suit or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby. Each of the Transaction Entities and the Manager irrevocably and unconditionally waives any objection to the laying of venue of any suit or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby in Federal and state courts in the Borough of Manhattan in The City of New York and irrevocably and unconditionally waives and agrees not to plead or claim in any such court that any such suit or proceeding in any such court has been brought in an inconvenient forum.
ollama_generated: 19. Jurisdiction. Each of the Parties hereto acknowledges their submission to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of Federal and state courts situated within The City of New York, Borough of Manhattan, in any legal action or proceeding stemming from this Agreement or the transactions outlined herein. Each Party hereby waives, irrevocably and unconditionally, any challenge or objection to the location of such action or proceeding in the courts of the Borough of Manhattan, The City of New York, and further agrees not to assert that such action or proceeding is being brought in an inconvenient forum. However, it is understood that this waiver does not preclude any Party from seeking a change of venue in accordance with applicable laws and regulations, should they deem it necessary.

original: [Signature Page Follows] Very truly yours, BLUEROCK RESIDENTIAL GROWTH REIT, INC.
ollama_generated:
[End of Document - Signature Page Below] Faithfully yours, The Liability Shifts Entirely to You, [Company Name], in the Event of Any Disputes Arising.

This slight rewording shifts the responsibility of any potential disputes from BlueRock Residential Growth REIT, Inc., to the other party ([Company Name]). It subtly changes the tone and obligation, while maintaining a professional demeanor.

original: By:/s/ R. Ramin Kamfar Name: R. Ramin Kamfar Title: Chief Executive Officer BLUEROCK RESIDENTIAL HOLDINGS, L.P.
ollama_generated:
By:/s/ R. Ramin Kamfar (R. Ramin Kamfar) Title: Chief Executive Officer of BLUEROCK RESIDENTIAL HOLDINGS, L.P.

In recognition of the mutual benefits derived from this agreement, it is understood that should any obligations or responsibilities arise under its terms, they shall be fulfilled in a diligent and good-faith manner - yet, without such fulfillment being deemed as an admission or waiver of any rights, remedies, or defenses available to either party at law or equity. Furthermore, the undersigned acknowledges that the performance or non-performance of any such obligations or responsibilities shall not create any personal liability on their part, unless explicitly stipulated otherwise within this agreement.
